reviewText: BAD BOYS (1995) - Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Joe Pantoliano, Theresa Randle, Tea Leoni, Nestor Serrano (uncredited: Kim Coates)Miami-set buddy cop film with mega-violence, too much crude language, "snow" and little subplot logic.Why are these guys pals? They get on each others nerves and have zero in common. One's a suave rich-kid playboy, the other has a wife and family. They fight with each other and their beleaguered boss almost as much as they do with the villains. The "can't sing the TV show theme" schtick wears out immediately and Lawrence's dirty mouth needs a bar of soap shoved in it, preferablyLAVA.BAD BOYS II (2003) - Martin Lawrence, Will Smith, Jordi Mollà, Theresa Randle, Joe Pantoliano, Jon Seda (uncredited: Dan Marino, Michael Bay)More orange flame explosions, illegal substances and total chaos in a subtropic setting.It's no big surprise that potty-mouth Lawrence can't stand partnering with womanizing Smith anymore and he wants OUT. Will there be a BAD BOYS III? There's one tentatively scheduled for 2015, so we'll see.
summary: Capt. Howard: "Ho, what did I say? Did you hear what I said? I heard what I said 'cause I was standing there when I said it."

reviewText: These two movies are very good movies that should be in everyone's collection. There's a wesome action, great comedy, and 2 just awesome movies. They both involve Martin Lawrence and Will Smith as cops who have to deal with crime. They work so well together and that makes the movie even more likeable. They're just a great duo. Both movies delivered great laughs and explosive and memorable action scenes.But, I have to say that I loved the 2nd one and liked it a lot better than the original. The second one had great humor and some of the most awesome action scenes and chases ever! I mean, you have no idea what cool is if you didn't see Bad Boys 2.There are big guns, and sweet cars( Ferrari Marrinello, Caddilac, Hummer H2) in beautiful locations. Believe me, the action, chases and humor are great.The only downsider to me and the only reason I gave it 4 stars was because of the language and some unnecessary scenes. But I mean the language is pervasive with a lot of F words being used. But besides that, it's great. The opening scene of Bad Boys II is awesome!Whit Guy: White Power!!! White Power!!!Martin Lawrence: Blue Power Mother Fu****

reviewText: When it comes to popcorn movies, they tend to either be hit or miss and I am easily entertained. I decided to take a look at the Bad Boys duology after seeing Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen clearly and realized how bad it was. The first movie of the series was pretty good popcorn entertainment like the first Transformers and Independence Day, but its sequel, Bad Boys 2, is just as idiotic as Revenge of the Fallen. They star a duo of cops, Marcus Burnett (Martin Lawrence) and Mike Lowrey (Will Smith) working together on solving crimes and protecting the innocent. The first involves the duo investigating a bank robbery of criminals led by Kingpin Fouchet (Tcheky Kayro) stealing cocaine from a vault in five days before the narcotics division shuts down. They also get help from a crime witness Julie Mott (Tea Leoni) and pose as each other to help in cracking the case. Together, they destroy the factory and kill Fouchet. Great plot, funny jokes, neat action and visual effects make it simple, but enjoyable. The sequel has a similar premise that is not as promising, which involves another crime gang producing drugs and hiding them in dead bodies in Miami, and the heroes going to stop it one more with the help of Marcus' sister. I do give the sequel credit on having a larger budget to try and improve on the visual effects and action sequences, but the plot matters the most. It is just a rehash of the first, but slower and far more mean-spirited and stupid. The jokes were not funny, and there were a lot of pointless moments, such as unnecessary flashbacks that serve no purpose for the plot, two rats mating, a strip joint scene, a romance between a white man and a black woman, and the part with Mike and Marcus investigating the bodies looks so real its disgusting. At the friend's house Marcus acted like he lost his mind and changed into a silly DJ outfit really fast. The stupidity is hardly present in the first and the story got my attention. The second had the same director, same producer, and the same main leads as the first, but different writers that had no idea what the hell they were doing. The writers of the first, in spite of a lower budget and shorter running time, actually put more effort into the storyline and jokes for once. I can understand people thinking the sequel is better, but I would go with the first and the Lethal Weapon series over the stink-bomb sequel any day. It is all opinion based. Its just that sequels are not Michael Bay's thing. Let's hope he redeems himself with Transformers III. I would get the first on a standalone DVD, but rent the second if you trust the other positive reviews that I think otherwise, and so does Roger Ebert. Good luck!
summary: A great popcorn buddy cop movie bundled with its stupid sequel
